thread.title: Baton Rouge area calendar for Oct. 9-15, 2015
thread.title_full: Baton Rouge area calendar for Oct. 9-15, 2015

title: Baton Rouge area calendar for Oct. 9-15, 2015
text:
Baton Rouge area calendar for Oct. 9-15, 2015 Baton Rouge area calendar for Oct. 9-15, 2015 Advocate staff photo by M.W. Willis -- A model train runs at the annual Trainfest in Jackson, Louisiana. This year's event starts at 10 a.m. Saturday. Advocate story Comments FRIDAY 
30TH ANNUAL LOUISIANA ART & SCIENCE MUSEUM GALA: 7:30 p.m.-10 p.m., Louisiana Arts & Science Museum, 100 S. River Road. Celebrating the International Year of Light, the evening features music, conversation, and a buffet provided by more than 20 restaurants and caterers. To purchase tickets or for more information, visit lasm.org/gala . SATURDAY-SUNDAY 
“SOUL”: 2 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. Saturday, 3 p.m. Sunday, Independence Park Theatre, 7800 Independence Blvd. A story of music through dance, beginning with the 1960s and evolving to present day. $20. Tickets may be purchased at (225) 588-7576 or nvtarts.org . 
KIDS’ LAB: 11 a.m., 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Saturday; 1:30 p.m. and 3 p.m. Sunday, Louisiana Arts And Science Museum, 100 S. River Road. Explore the pH scale using two very different methods. BASF Kids’ Lab requires adult participation and is offered on a first-come, first-served basis with registration. Email kidslab@lasm.org for more information. SATURDAY 
CROQUET DAY: 10 a.m., Louisiana’s Old State Capitol, 100 N. Blvd. Watch this area’s only group of professional croquet players, the Red Stick Croquet Club. Participants will have a chance to play with professionals. Bring a blanket and lawn chairs. 
SIXTH ANNUAL TRAINFEST: 10 a.m.-3 p.m., 3406 College St., Jackson, Indoor and outdoor model trains in all popular American scales, including “live steam” model locomotives. Admission is free, and food will be available. Visit greaterbrrailroaders.com for more information. 
CAP CITY BEER FEST: 11 a.m.-3 p.m., North Boulevard Town Square. Local and national craft breweries will be on hand as well as food in this inaugural event. Tickets are $40 in advance, $50 at the door. For more information, visit capcitybeerfest.org . 
CONTRA DANCE: 5 p.m.-7:30 p.m., St. Alban’s Chapel, corner of Highland and Dalrymple. Live music by Kendall Rogers and Pete Dawson. No experience or partner necessary. Admission is $6. (225) 803-9194. SUNDAY 
“PATIO PARTY” CELEBRATION: Noon-2 p.m., Louisiana’s Old State Capitol, 100 N. Blvd. Young children and their families are invited to celebrate with author, Johnette Downing, as she launches her newest children’s books. 
LOUISIANA SINFONIETTA CONCERT: 2 p.m., LSU School of Music Recital Hall, Dalrymple Drive. Maestro Dinos Constantinides will conduct the Sinfonietta Wind Quintet in a program of chamber music old and new by Mozart, Gounod, Stravinsky and local composers, Harold Mims and Michael Paul Mitchell. Soloists are Arisia Gilmore, horn; John Coppa, clarinet; Suzanne Buerkle, flute, and mezzo-soprano, Chelsey Geeting. Tickets available at the door. Adults $15 and students $5. For more information, call (225) 766-3487. THURSDAY 
HISTORIC HOME AND NEIGHBORHOOD TOUR OF NEW ORLEANS BUS TRIP: 7 a.m.-5 p.m., West Baton Rouge Museum, 845 N. Jefferson Ave., Port Allen. Participants will view prominent historic houses on Esplanade Ave. and others in the Crescent City’s most historic neighborhoods. A homemade Creole breakfast with a complimentary Bloody Mary or Mimosa and a box lunch will be served. The cost for the all-inclusive bus trip is $95. INAUGURAL STACI A. PEPITONE PUTT PUTT CLASSIC: 6 P.M.-8 P.M., CELEBRATION STATION, 10111 GWENADELE AVE. UNLIMITED ACCESS TO MINIATURE GOLF, GO-KARTS, PLAYLAND, AND THE PIZZA BUFFET. PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE A GOODY BAG. TICKETS ARE $30 AND CAN BE PURCHASED AT GEAUXPASTCANCER.ORG. 
DOG TRAINING FIVE-WEEK COURSE REGISTRATION: 6:30 p.m., Blue Cross parking lot off Bluebonnet Boulevard. Classes open for puppy through advanced courses. lccoc.org 
HEARTBEAT: 6:30 p.m.-8:30 p.m., Hartley/Vey Workshop Theatre, 100 Lafayette St. An open mic poetry reading for students grades six and below. Young attendees must be accompanied by adult or guardian. OPENING FRIDAY 
KEN TATE EXHIBITION: 9 a.m.-5 p.m., Ann Connelly Fine Art, 4221 Perkins Road. The exhibition will feature the Intervention, Deconstructed and Luminous Squeegee series by the artist on paper and canvas. ONGOING 
NEIGHBORHOOD ARTS PROJECT: Serving four communities — Scotlandville, Gardere, Old South Baton Rouge, and Melrose East. Art activities are developed around themes that celebrate different artists across cultures as well as exhibitions on view at the LSU Museum of Art. The education department also integrates a science or math component. All activities are adapted to pre-school through high school ages. (225) 389-7212. 
CAPITOL CITY CONTEMPORARY 2 — THE LANDSCAPES: Through Jan. 10, Louisiana Arts And Science Museum, 100 S. River Road. The annual display spotlights the age-old tradition of landscape painting. 
CAAWS CAT ADOPTIONS: 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturdays, Acadian Village Petco, 3535 Perkins Road. caaws.org 
CAAWS DOG ADOPTIONS: 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturdays, CAAWS Shelter, 6357 Quinn Drive. caaws.org 
CAT ADOPTIONS: Noon-6 p.m. Monday through Saturday, Cat Haven Adoption Center, 11130 N. Harrell’s Ferry Road. (225) 636-2680. 
DULCIMER SOCIETY BEGINNER CLASSES: 5:30 p.m. - 6:30 p.m., Mondays through Nov. 2, Community Bible Church, 8354 Jefferson Highway. Adults as well as children, over 10 years old. A parent must stay with their child. Contact Helen Bankston at (225) 753-7917 to register. Free event and loaner dulcimers will be available. 
DOCTOR SPARK, THE ROVING EXPLAINER: Noon-2 p.m., Saturdays, Louisiana Arts And Science Museum, 100 S. River Road. Celebrate the International Year of Light with Dr. Spark. 
ELIZABETHAN GALLERY: 680 Jefferson Highway. Hours are 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Monday-Friday and 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday. elizabethangallery.com 
FRAMEWORKS GALLERY: 8501 Highland Road. Hours are 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesday-Thursday, and 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday. For more information, call (225) 769-0582 or visit fwgallery.net. 
THE GALLERY AT MANSHIP THEATRE: 100 Lafayette St. manshiptheatre.org 
JONES WALKER FOYER: Shaw Center for the Arts, 100 Lafayette St. “Do You See What I See?,” featuring photography by Denise Roussel, runs through Oct. 11. Hours are 11 a.m.-5 p.m. Sunday, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday, and 9 a.m.-11 p.m. Tuesday-Saturday. Free. (225) 346-5001. 
LOUISIANA ART & SCIENCE MUSEUM: 100 River Road S. (225) 344-5272 or lasm.org 
LOUISIANA’S OLD STATE CAPITOL: 100 N. Blvd. Hours: 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Tuesday-Saturday. (225) 342-0500. 
LSU MUSEUM OF ART: Shaw Center for the Arts, 100 Lafayette St. Check out the exhibitions “Toulouse-Lautrec and La Vie Moderne: Paris 1880-1910,” running through March 20, 2016 and “Shaking Up Prohibition: The Cocktail Drawings of Olive Leonhardt,” through Oct. 31. lsumoa.org 
LSU SCHOOL OF ART’S ALFRED C. GLASSELL JR. GALLERY: Shaw Center for the Arts, 100 Lafayette St. Hours: 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesday-Friday, and noon-5 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. (225) 389-7180. 
MISS TRUDY’S TRAVELING TRUNK SHOW: 11 a.m., Louisiana Arts & Science Museum, Adalié Brent Auditorium, 100 S. River Road. An interactive program for young children that explores the art and science of the seasons. 
PET ADOPTIONS: 10 a.m.-5 p.m., Companion Animal Alliance, 2680 Progress Road. (225) 774-7701. 
PET ADOPTIONS: 11:30 a.m.- 4 p.m. Saturday and 12:30 p.m.-4 p.m. Sunday, PetSmart, 8660 Airline Hwy. Kittens, cats, puppies and dogs are available from the Northside Humane Society. (225) 964-6992. 
PET ADOPTIONS: 11:30 p.m.-5:30 p.m. Monday through Friday, 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, Friends of the Animals Adoption House, 8476 Highland Road. friendsoftheanimalsbr.org 
PLANETARIUM SHOWS: 10 a.m.- 3 p.m. Tuesday-Friday, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday, and 1 p.m.-4 p.m. Sunday, Louisiana Art and Science Museum, 100 S. River Road. (225) 344-527. 
SUN LIGHT/STAR LIGHT — CONTEMPLATIONS ON THE SOLAR ORB: Through Jan. 3, Louisiana Arts And Science Museum, 100 S. River Road. Multi-media exhibition, explore the scientific, aesthetic, and spiritual dimensions regarding the moon and sun. 
WEST BATON ROUGE MUSEUM: 845 N. Jefferson Ave., Port Allen. “House & Home” will be on display through Oct. 18. Walk-in and scheduled tours are now available in French. westbatonrougemuseum.org 
WINE WALK: 5:30 p.m. Wednesdays, Restaurant IPO, 421 Third St. Taste wines and enjoy foods in downtown Baton Rouge. $10 for a wine bracelet and a wine card for the list of venues and the number of tastings. Must be 21 years old. restaurantipo.com 
Yelp! BR Pet Adoptions: Noon-4 p.m. Sundays, and 3 p.m. Tuesdays and Thursdays, Petco Acadian Village, 3535 Perkins Road. Applications accepted for adoption approval. (225) 485-9200 or info@yelpbr.com 
Compiled by Whitney Christy
